Abstract: Label-free electrochemical methods have emerged as a promising approach for disease detection, offering significant advantages in terms of simplicity, cost-effectiveness, and rapid analysis. These techniques leverage the intrinsic electrochemical properties of biomolecules, eliminating the need for additional labeling agents, which can complicate the detection process. Recent advancements in biosensing and analytical chemistry have enhanced the sensitivity and specificity of these methods, enabling the detection of various biomarkers associated with diseases. This review highlights the latest developments in label-free electrochemical biosensors, focusing on their application in diagnostics. The integration of nanomaterials and innovative electrode designs has further improved their performance, paving the way for their potential use in point-of-care testing and personalized medicine.
